questions.question_text:
A network administrator is configuring client provisioning resource policies for client machines and must ensure that an agent pop-up is presented to the client when attempting to connect to the network.
Which configuration item needs to be added to allow for this?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The correct answer is - the client provisioning URL in the authorization policy.

To ensure that an agent pop-up is presented to the client when attempting to connect to the network, the network administrator must add the client provisioning URL to the authorization policy. This URL will specify the location of the agent that will be downloaded and installed on the client machine.

Once the URL is added to the authorization policy, the network administrator must assign it to the appropriate endpoints. This can be done manually or through a dynamic assignment rule.

When an endpoint connects to the network, Cisco ISE will check the endpoint's authorization status. If the endpoint is not authorized, Cisco ISE will redirect the endpoint to the client provisioning URL. The endpoint will then download and install the agent, which will present the user with a pop-up window.

Selected Answer: C
It is mandatory to include the client provisioning URL in authorization policy to enable the agent to popup in the client machines. This prevents request from any random clients and ensures that only clients with proper redirect URL can request for posture assessment.

Selected Answer: C
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/ise/2-4/admin_guide/b_ISE_admin_guide_24/m_configure_client_provisioning.html#ID1405
It is mandatory to include the client provisioning URL in authorization policy to enable the agent to popup in the client machines. This prevents request from any random clients and ensures that only clients with proper redirect URL can request for posture assessment.

Selected Answer: C
correct answier is C
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/ise/2-4/admin_guide/b_ISE_admin_guide_24/m_configure_client_provisioning.html

choices.A: a temporal agent that gets installed onto the system
choices.D: an API connection back to the client
choices.B: a remote posture agent proxying the network connection
choices.C: the client provisioning URL in the authorization policy

questions.question_text:
An employee must access the internet through the corporate network from a new mobile device that does not support native supplicant provisioning provided by
Cisco ISE.
Which portal must the employee use to provision to the device?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
My Devices: The My Devices portal empowers employees to add, register, and manage their personal devices, including those that do not support a native supplicant. Ref OCG. p. 168

Selected Answer: A
My Devices Portal. Check CCNP SISE OFC page 168, figure 7.58

questions.question_text: Which two task types are included in the Cisco ISE common tasks support for TACACS+ profiles? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
This is correct
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/ise/3-1/admin_guide/b_ise_admin_3_1/b_ISE_admin_31_device_admin.html#id_16384
In the Cisco ISE GUI, click the Menu icon () and choose Work Centers > Device Administration > Policy Elements > Results > TACACS Profiles > Add to view the common tasks settings window. The Common Task Types are Shell, WLC, Nexus, and Generic.

Selected Answer: C
Is there any Authentication persona? It should be Policy Service.

Selected Answer: C
C is correct--the only Persona that interacts with an endpoint is Policy Service. B is not a real persona identity. PSN reviews the CPP to determine the correct NSP the supplies it to the BYOD process.
for it will go for authentication then move to personas
it should be C. policy service, since its looking for persona

questions.question_text:
An engineer is testing Cisco ISE policies in a lab environment with no support for a deployment server. In order to push supplicant profiles to the workstations for testing, firewall ports will need to be opened.
From which Cisco ISE persona should this traffic be originating?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AE
Provided answer correct

questions.question_text: What are two benefits of TACACS+ versus RADIUS for device administration? (Choose two.)

choices.E: TACACS+ encrypts the whole payload, and RADIUS encrypts only the password.
choices.C: TACACS+ supports 802.1X, and RADIUS supports MAB.
choices.D: TACACS+ provides the service type, and RADIUS does not.
choices.A: TACACS+ has command authorization, and RADIUS does not.
choices.B: TACACS+ uses UDP, and RADIUS uses TCP.
